The game comes with a set of vests to slide over the top of the pieces to remind you what your piece has plundered.
Watch out for those pawns!

25836.name: Zygomar
25836.description: Zygomar is a clown with the multiple aspects who will pose a series of varied challenges in the areas of observation, speed, anticipation, memory, mime, or even logic.

25837.name: Apprenti sorcier
25837.description: This is a board game apparently sold in book form. Events are determined with a paragraph system reminiscent of West End's Tales of the Arabian Nights.

25838.description: Addition Bingo is a children's educational game, made to teach children the very basics of addition.
25838.name: Addition Bingo

25839.name: Obsession
25839.description:
Obsession is a unique strategic-action game, which keeps you thinking. In order to play this interactive game, you need skill, quick reaction and strategic judgment.

You have to defend your men against all the attacks by your opponents, and block their plans in order to become the first to reach the center of the 3-dimensional board. (based on box-information)

25840.name: Monochrom
25840.description: Abstract two-player game with short playing time. Connect all your pieces on the board. You can move in a straight line, but you cannot stop before you hit an obstacle. But you can bring one adjacent piece with you.

boardgameimplementation: Nations in Arms: Valmy to Waterloo
25841.description:
Le Grand Empire simulates the Napoleonic wars from 1800 to 1815 at a strategic level. Two maps cover Europe and North Africa from Caucasus to Ireland and from Sweden to Egypt. 780 counters personify land and naval units as well as every corps-commanding leader of that time. The combat units are army corps and fleets, and sometimes entire armies. Their content varies with the player’s will and the contingencies of that era; Guard, line infantry, Elite, light cavalry, heavy cavalry, militia, Cossacks, and so on. The game turns are season-based and interactive, including a variable number of impulses. A budget phase occurs every fall.

The game can involve two players (one French and one anti-French), or five players (France, Great-Britain, Prussia, Russia and Austria), or even seven players (Spain and the Ottoman Empire have their own player). Of course, victory conditions vary accordingly.

The operational part of the game points out the importance of leadership and line of communication; attrition can be very high. Evasive actions and interceptions lead to the deployment of armies followed by battle. Battle occurs in the same hex; troop quality, tactical choices and leader values are taken into account in the issue of the battle.

At the strategic level, the players are responsible for their unit’s production and maintenance. Diplomacy is the key point in creating alliances with other powers, major or minor. Moreover, many random events improve the Napoleonic flavor of that time.

The overall purpose of the Grand Empire is to provide a strategic Napoleonic game that takes into account historical, military and diplomatic sights, and that can be played in a short period of time (one year is four turns and can be played in two hours) with a reasonable amount of rules.

Contents :
* Two maps
* 3 countersheets (260 double sided counters each).
* one rulebook and one scenarios booklet.
* 2 dice.
* Tables and charts
25841.name: Le Grand Empire

25842.name: Tabulos: Leer de tafels met Dokus
25842.description: Children's game about table manners and food. Probably published in the early '90s.

25843.name: De Rode Ridder
25843.description: Based on the popular comic books and novels De Rode Ridder (written by Karel Biddeloo). Each player either plays De Rode Ridder or one of his opponents. The game book contains scenarios for play. In each scenario De Rode Ridder has to fulfill a quest, and his opponents do everything they can to stop him.

25844.name: Leksis
25844.description:
Description from the back of the box:

Leksis is a literary game, where you construct your own crossword puzzles. Again and again.

You can play alone or with others, and you decide for yourself how hard it should be.

Leksis contains 240 letter-pieces. A game where you can play with word puzzles in any language.

25845.name: Les Cracks
25845.description: This French cycling game from the '80s is played on a 69*22cm. board that 2 to 5 cyclists, each controlled by a player. Before the game starts, players choose how many étappes will be played (usually between 4 and 8). At the start each player has 6 cards in his hand. A card can contain advantages or bad luck (when this card is played it is played as bad luck to another cyclist). After every turn a the hand is refilled till 6. Every étappe is 200km. The winner of the game is the player who scores the best in the overall classifying of all étappes.

25846.name: Les Géants de la Route
25846.description:
This cycling game is based upon the Tour de France. The box contains 1 board (46*46cm.), 6 cyclists, 2 dice, cyclist cards and energy indicators. The game consists of 3 different étappes. Every player controls one cyclist that has stars (maximum 3) in one specialty, either climbing, descending or riding on a flat terrain. The stars determine how fast a cyclist can go on this terrain. To speed up there are two ways to attack, either a risky or normal attack. A risky attack means that the energy of the cyclist will decrease. A cyclist can also follow the slipstream of another player, that will cost the one in front 1 energy point. Winner is the player who gets the best overall result of the 3 étappes.

The "Maillot Jaune, Le Jeu de Bernard Hinault" version is based upon Tour de France legend Bernard Hinault, five time winner of the Tour.

25847.description: Horseshoe or Block is the English names for a game played in southeast Asia. It is a simple game of blockade played by two players on a board of five points, with each player having two pieces. The aim of the game for a player is to block the pieces of the other so as to prevent his movement.
25847.name: Horseshoe

25848.name: Madelinette
25848.description: Madelinette is a small, simple game of blockade, probably invented by J & J Loader for their book, Making Board, Peg and Dice Games. There seems to be no reference to this game before the publishing of this book. Two players strive on a board of seven points, each with three pieces, to block in their opponent's pieces so that the opponent cannot move. Information on this game is sparse, as it is overshadowed by the similar-looking three men's morris, for which it is often mistaken. A game board in the Hull and East Riding Museum, in Yorkshire, England, is often mistaken for this game in photographs but would rather seem to be an incomplete three men's morris board, this has been confirmed by the curator.

25849.name: Milk Race Game
25849.description:
At the time that this cycling game was released the Milk Race was the only professional multiple-day cycling race in the United Kingdom. It was published by British company Jason Games.

Each player controls one cyclist on the board. The movement is determined by spinning a wheel in the middle of the board and by dice. There are also tactical cards that can be played. The board also has sprint and time trial sections.

25850.name: Cyclo
25850.description:
The first version (Lampre edition) in 1999 was made for the Italian Lampre cycling outfit and only distributed amongst their customers. The 2nd edition from 2000 was commercialized and is known as the Lotto edition. The only difference is the cover of the box.

Cyclo is a cycling game where each player controls a team of 5 cyclists, each team in a different color. The gameboard consists of 5 double strokes that can be used to form different tracks. There are 3 dice, downhill all 3 may be used, during climbing only 1 die may be rolled. Cyclists can slipstream when staying behind another cyclist.

Although this is a dice controlled game (which means luck involved) Cyclo still manages to simulate the cycling board quite well.

25851.name: Surf the World
25851.description:
Surf the World has been created by a surfer with over 40 years of surfing experience and travels. This is the perfect game to play on flat or blown-out days, or at any time with the whole family.

Wipeout! walk the nose.... Drop in on a local.

Camp at surf spots. Collect all eight wave cards from famed surf breaks. Land on a secret spot to put yourself in front.....

Take off on a wave and surf your way around the world. During your ride, you will experience the thrills and obstacles every surfer encounters.

Learn some of the history and traditions that have helped shape this lifestyle.

Surf the World is the perfect addition to the surfing paraphernalia collected by every surfer. Once you finish the ride, you will be paddling back out for another wave. This is a game for young and old, surfers and non-surfers.

Equipment for the trip:
Game Board, 150 Question Cards, 48 Wave Cards, 6 Movers, 2 Dice, Rules

25852.name: Addition Bingo
25852.description: Addition Bingo is an educational children's version of Bingo, designed to teach children addition, while retaining the flavor of Bingo.

25853.name: UNO: New York Yankees
25853.description:
A series of Uno variants based on assorted major league baseball teams.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The Yankee Stadium Card. If a Draw 2 or Draw 4 card is played against you, play this card to block it. After discarding the Yankee Stadium card, designate a color of your choice and play resumes. This card can also be played at any time as a Wild card; you do not need to use it to block a Draw card. This card can also be played as your last card. The point value of the Yankee Stadium card is 50 points.

25854.name: Grumble, rumble... roar! game
25854.description:
OBJECT: To be the first player to move all four of his playing pieces from matching base to matching finish.

PLAY:
1. First player must roll a one or a four to move any of his playing pieces from BASE to START. Play moves to the left.

2. Once a playing piece has been placed on START, player may move four spaces, he is entitled to an additional turn.

3. Each time a player rolls a four and is able to move four spaces, he is entitled to an additional turn.

4. A player must roll the exact number to move his playing pieces into the HOME spaces.

5. A player may not pass or land on one of his own playing pieces.

6. When a player lands on a space occupied by ANOTHER PLAYER, he replaces that player's playing piece with his own and sends the other player's playing piece back to the matching base, where that player must start again.

BONUS:
1. When a player's roll of the die places his playing piece exactly on any of the six black BONUS spaces, around the center of the board, he may, on his next turn, choose to move that playing piece around the board, using the black BONUS spaces only and thus shorten the path to HOME.

2. He moves the number of spaces as rolled, counting around the BONUS spaces until he reaches the row by his HOME and continuing down that row the remaining number on the die.

DOUBLE BONUS:
1. The center black space is a double bonus space that may be entered from any location on the board, by rolling the exact number to land there.

2. In order to leave the double bonus space, a player must roll a one and he then proceeds to any of the six bonus spaces on the board.
IN BOTH OF THE ABOVE BONUS CASES, IF A PLAYER LANDS ON A BONUS SPACE ALREADY OCCUPIED BY ANOTHER PLAYER, RULE 6 OF PLAY APPLIES.

TO WIN: To be the first player to move all four playing pieces to the matching home is the winner.

25855.name: Palabras Ocultas
25855.description:
A game in Scattergories's line, published in 1990 by Borras Plana S.A en España. The players (or teams) have to write many words that begin with the corresponding letter and of the category of the indicated letter, before the sand timer runs out. It has 24 topics and different letters. Play for 12 turns.

---

Un juego en la línea de Scattergories, publicado en 1990 por Borras Plana S.A in Spain. Los jugadores (o equipos) han de escribir la mayor cantidad de palabras que empiecen por la letra correspondiente y de la categoría de la carta indicada, en el tiempo que marca un reloj de arena. Tiene 24 temas y letras diferentes. Se juega en 12 turnos.

25856.name: La Etapo
25856.description: This huge French cycling game consists of a massive 108*73cm. vinyl mapboard, 6 teams of 3 cyclists each and 1 yellow and 1 white cyclist. Also included: 1 die and 66 cards. The game is bilingual in French and... Esperanto (!). Each team consists of a sprinter, a climber and a rouleur (time rider who is strong on flat terrain). At the start of the game every player (sporting director) also receives 4 tactical cards that can be played at any moment. There also is a point system for the individual overall classification, the mountains and a point system for the teams so a player can go for different objectives. He can try to win the teams championship, mountains or go for the individual overall win with one of his cyclists.

25857.name: Chasse Patate
25857.description: Chasse Patate is a cycling game designed by Eric Le Bras, who lives in La Rochelle, France. The dimensions of the board are 59x41cms. There are 5 teams of each 2 cyclists (plastic figures). Tactics- and bad luck card plus 4 dice make the game complete. Each team has one climber and one rouleur. Movement is done by rolling the dice but the cards also have an influence. The board is divided into different étappe sections and has an interesting mechanism to determine time differences for the overall classifying. Winner is the player whose team does best for the overall lead.

25858.name: Olympics 1980
25858.description: This game based on the Olympics has quite a large box (70x43cm.) and a big plastic board that includes an athletic track. Players have to participate in 8 events: 400mt. spring, javelin, shot put, pole vault, spear throwing, marathon high jump, and long jump. The rulebook is after a classic intro told in a comic book way. Vintage game for collectors, made in Belgium.

25859.name: Herstory
25859.description:
Publisher:

When you play Herstory, your travel along the game path will in many ways parallel the experiences of women throughout four hundred years of American history.

Your playing marker will be sent backward and forward on the board depending on whether an event described on your "Herstory card" was a victory or a defeat for women's advancement. You will also be sent to areas of the game board which symbolize key aspects of women's lives: home, employment, personal style, and public achievement. As American women have known both frustration and triumph in their struggle for equality, you too will progress or lose ground on the board as you learn the landmark developments of women's history, the fight for women's suffrage, and the continuing effort for fair treatment at work and at home.

The game is designed for both simple and more complex play. Those players who have had little exposure to women's history will most enjoy the simple version, which familiarizes them with details and people but does not test their knowledge. Those players who are ready for the risks (and pleasures) of a challenge will enjoy the complex version. Here questions are asked and must be answered in the course of pursuing the goal and planning game strategy.

In both game versions, the objective is to reach the end of the path where the Statue of Liberty stands as a symbol of freedom of choice and opportunity - the life goal of both women and men in America.

25860.name: African-American Discovery
25860.description:
Publisher:

African-American Discovery is a trivia board game that helps you learn and review facts about significant African-Americans, African-American history, and African-American culture.

The object of the game is to score points by discovering the other players' famous names before your name is discovered, by answering history questions from the Fact-Finder cards, and by winning points on various squares on the board.

The game is won when there is only one player left. However, in a game in which a time limit is set, the player with the highest score wins.

25862.name: Insider Dealing
25862.description:
From the rules:
"Insider Dealing is a fun boardgame which recreates all the excitement of dealing - legal and illegal! - in the Stock Exchange."

The object of the game is to make it back to the start square with £1 million. As you would expect, players hope to make profits by buying and selling shares in one or more of six companies whose prices can rise or fall dramatically during the course of the game. Share prices are affected by several means.
1 - Market Information cards. These have immediate effect on one (or more rarely all) companies once a player lands on a particular square
2 - The Stock Exchange. Players select a company in which they have a minimum holding and roll dice to determine the extent and direction of the share price of that company.
3 - Inside Information cards. The most fun, these cards can be kept by players and played at the most advantageous moment. For example, by raising a share price immediately before you sell, or dropping it as you want to buy (or your opponents sell!).

This UK game was released at the height of the yuppie, 'greed is good' period in the late 80's.

25863.name: Little Bo Peep
25863.description:
Little Bo Peep has lost her sheep and you must spin and move to find them...

Play starts with four sheep of each player's respective color on the board, plus a black sheep in the middle. Regular sheep may be picked up in passing. The black sheep may only be picked up when you have all four of your own sheep and must be landed on by exact count. The player to successfully claim his own four sheep plus the black sheep wins.

The game has no copyright date, but pre-dates the use of zip codes in U.S. addresses.

25864.description:
Match the Colors and Stack Away!

Build your way across the board with LEGO® Dominos – the first color-based Dominos game! Players match and stack their dominos based on color, choosing to zig zag their way to the finish line or block an opponent.

It's great fun for kids to learn colors and practice fine motor skills and fun for adults too!

Contains 56 LEGO bricks, 28 LEGO plates, game board and instructions.
25864.name: LEGO Dominos

25865.description:
Scribe is a pen and paper game for two players. The board, a 9x9 super grid of 3x3 mini grids, is simple enough to be drawn by hand. There are two major components of play: a mapping mechanism and a system of glyphs, or patterns of orthogonally adjacent squares. The mapping mechanism works as follows. Your last move points to the mini grid in which your next move must be made. For example, if your last move was in the upper left corner of a mini grid, then your next move must be made somewhere in the upper left mini grid. The glyph system works as follows. There are 19 named glyphs of various sizes from 1 to 9 orthogonally adjacent squares. Glyphs that you form during play are worth points. The majority of points scored in a mini grid wins the mini grid. The winner of the majority of mini grids wins the game.

For the complete rules to Scribe, see http://marksteeregames.com/

Online Play


Super Duper Games
25865.name: Scribe

25866.description: Wizard Junior uses the same game play as its older brother, Wizard, with players bidding on the number of tricks they will take during a hand, but simplifies things for the younguns so they can get a handle on trumps and tricks. Wizard Junior uses colors instead of suits, and each color has fewer cards than the 13 used in the original game. The game also takes players through two bidding rounds for each hand so that they get a better handle on what others expect to take and how to judge their hand.
25866.name: Wizard Junior

25867.name: Shape of Things
25867.description: A matching game in which each player blindly selects an object from a pouch and sees if it matches his game board. Matches can either be shape only for very young children or shape and color for young children.

25868.name: Courtyard
25868.description:
From the publisher:
It is the height of the castle building era in Europe - and it is a matter of national pride that the royal couple's courtyard be the most ornate and splendid in the land.

Courtyard melds high-quality wooden components, traditional medieval themes, and simple border drawing mechanics to create a strategy game with a timeless feel.

Contains:
80 laser engraved wooden tiles
4 Player Tile Trays

25869.name: Duck Duck Boom
25869.description:
From the publisher:
The only thing more irresistible than the title is the addictive gameplay. Watch out for Sooperduck!

Duck Duck Boom! is a fun game that offers a few twists. Choose your target and take aim! Add a little "helper" to improve your aim. But beware, your opponents also add "helpers" that can help or hinder your efforts, and every once in a while, one of the ducks shoot back!

A great family game that also teaches basic addition and subtraction.

Contains:
30 ducks, 25 "Helper" tiles, 5 tiles of Boom!
2 Custom Dice
Rules

25870.name: Cambridge
25870.description:
Publisher's Description:
A challenging word game. The next step in the evolution of Hangman. A new board every time. Players write their word and begin a race to "reveal" the letters. A few twists on the same old word game. Challenging family fun.

Includes:
26 Alphabet tiles
4 "Honor" tiles
5 Player tokens

25871.name: Central Pacific
25871.description:
Publisher's Description:
Can you build the first transcontinental railroad across the United States? Central Pacific is a 2-4 player, wide open game of building railroads. Build over and tunnel under mountains, through forests. Forge rail links between cities and steal a few of your opponents'.

A great introduction to railroad gaming, and a quick fix for those already addicted to the genre. Can be played out-of-pocket on any surface. It's the perfect answer to the question "What should we play while we wait for Pete to show up?

Includes:
80 wooden rail tiles
1 "Golden Spike"
28 train (player) tokens
8 Stock Market / Land Grant tokens

25872.description:
Publisher's Description:

Collect your tiles from the Sphere. Rain to the Stream. Stream to the Sea.

YangTzee is the "ancient" game of tile matching that's as swift as a stream. Each tile has two symbols and one blossom. Match blossoms in order to score. Simple rules, top-notch wooden components, surprising depth of play.

Contains:
45 Wooden Tiles
1 Scoring Track
4 Scoring Markers
2 Tile Trays
25872.name: YangTzee

25873.name: Sand Castles
25873.description:
Publisher's Description:

Sand Castles is a 2-player game of flexible building strategy. Players must compete against the waves and each other. Whoever builds the most castles wins. There are always two castle designs to build. Roll the dice, collect the sand pails, towers and waves, and build your castles one "block" at a time.

Intuitive rules, a new challenge each game.

Kids love it. Great for improving spatial and planning skills.

Contains:
60 Wooden "Builder" Tiles
24 Wooden "Castle" Tiles
2 Custom dice

25874.name: Extreme!
25874.description:
Publisher's Description:

You are an Extreme! athlete, trying your hand at a variety of Extreme! sports. But be careful. Extreme! sports pose Extreme! risks. Injuries can happen at any time. Choose your sport, roll the dice, and try to have the longest, most Extreme! career!

A humorous "injury management" game about Extreme! sports.

Contains:
3 custom Extreme! Dice
4 player mats
50 Extreme! condition markers

25875.name: Saga
25875.description:
From the rules

"Each [player represents a] raider [who] sets out with 500 men and his aim is to take Perth. Before taking Perth, he must hold at least 6 other settlements and must enter Perth with no fewer than 100 men."

Movement on a hex map and hazards on the map will cause you to lose men on your way. You can raid other players settlements.

25876.name: Oscar Robertson's Pro Basketball Strategy
boardgamepublisher: Research Games, Inc. / Athol / RGI / ARC
25876.description:
Part of a 5 game series of Rocky Graziano (Boxing), Vince Lombardi (Football), Gil Hodges (Baseball), Rod Gilbert (Hockey), and Oscar Robertson (Basketball).

Historical players are rated on 2 basic and 1 optional factors and advancement on court and shooting is dice and table driven. Results in high level treatment as players fall into broader groupings.

25877.name: Speed Circuit Turnier Kurs
25877.description:
The Speed Circuit Turnier Kurs was issued by "Das Spiel" in Hamburg and took the idea from the 1979 released edition "Speed Circuit Tournament Tracks".

The "Turnier Kurs" has also 2 tracks, a qualifying and a tournament track. Main differences to the original are a longer straight line and less curves on the qualifying track and a remarkable extension of the tournament track.

Expands:

Speed Circuit

25878.name: Rod Gilbert's Violent World of Pro Hockey
boardgamepublisher: Research Games, Inc. / Athol / RGI / ARC
25878.description:
Part of a 5 game series of Rocky Graziano (Boxing), Vince Lombardi (Football), Gil Hodges (Baseball), Rod Gilbert (Hockey), and Oscar Robertson (Basketball).

Historical players are given numeric offensive and defensive rating, with goalies having an alpha rating. Puck advancement and shooting is dice and table driven. Rules for fatigue require use of multiple lines and defensive pairs. Results in high level treatment as players fall into very broad groupings with the linear ratings. E.g., every forward was rated 1 on defensive.

25879.name: Gil Hodges' Pennant Fever
boardgamepublisher: Research Games, Inc. / Athol / RGI / ARC
25879.description:
Part of a 5 game series of Rocky Graziano (Boxing), Vince Lombardi (Football), Gil Hodges (Baseball), Rod Gilbert (Hockey), and Oscar Robertson (Basketball).

Historical players are rated with batters having a numeric contact and alpha power factor. Pitchers had a numeric pitching factor and numeric endurance factor. Certain players had special fielding or running or power pitching factors. Interaction of pitching and contact numbers and dice roll drives each at bat. Results in high level treatment as players fall into broader groupings with the linear numbers (contact and pitching numbers 3-9).

25880.name: Rocky Graziano Presents a Century of Great Fights
boardgamepublisher: Research Games, Inc. / Athol / RGI / ARC
25880.description:
Part of a 5 game series of Rocky Graziano (Boxing), Vince Lombardi (Football), Gil Hodges (Baseball), Rod Gilbert (Hockey), and Oscar Robertson (Basketball).

Historical boxers are grouped into two weight categories (light heavy/heavy and Middle to light) and rated on 8 different punch strategy categories, with 23 cards corresponding to the ratings (3 for each of first 7 strategies but only 2 clinches) plus an endurance rating. Players play hidden cards five times per round and there is a matrix for the interaction of all 23 cards. the die is only used on knockdowns. Because of the much wider variety of ratings, a fairly high difference is achieved for the 50 fighters included. Variations change some of the card interactions to eliminate possible "perfect strategy" which might be available in certain boxer combinations.

25881.name: The Time Tunnel Card Game
25881.description: Deck of cards with 4 suits of 1-13 representing 4 eras and two "time tunnel" cards and randomizing spinner directing travelers to each of the 4 eras. Various games could be played as variations of rummy, trick taking etc. Issued to take advantage of Time Tunnel television series which did not turn out as popular as hoped.

25882.name: Börse
25882.description:
This Heyne travel game is played on 3-piece board of 9x16 size. A exchange rate table is also included.

Players travel around the board, change the value of the shares as indicated on the landed spaces, buy and sell shares and try to have the most money at the end.

The bank starts with a limited amount of money - depending of the number of players - and the game ends, when the bank has no money left.

25883.description:
This Heyne travel game is played on 2-piece board of 8x8 round points. The 4 center points and 2 adjacent points are omitted; they form an impassable canyon.

Both players place their 15 tokens in one edge of the board and try to reach the other side - around the canyon. Jumping over tokens allows for faster movement of the tokens and jumping over an opponent's tokens eliminates them.

The game ends, when all (remaining) pieces of one player have reached the opposing edge. Every token scores points - the further the token gets the more points are scored. The player with the most points wins the game.
25883.name: Canyon

25884.description:
This game in travel format is played on a 3-piece board, 9x13 in size when assembled. Each player has 60 tiles. They come in 6 different designs, having 1-4 sides in the player's color and 0-3 sides in neutral white.

Every turn, a player draws one of his tiles and places it on the board according to the placing rules. Since the players have no tiles in hand to choose from, the chance that a tile cannot be placed (and a turn is missed) is relatively high. However, the unplayable tiles come into game later.

The game ends, when either all tiles are laid out or no further placement is possible. The player with the largest contiguous "island" is the winner.
25884.name: Contactic

25885.description:
This Heyne travel game is played on 3-piece board showing 2 identical halves with 26 round points each.

Players place 1 token per turn on the board trying to form a certain geometrical form with their pieces. When no player succeeds in reaching this, the game proceeds with movements of the token, still trying to form such a geometrical form.

But now, captures of tokens is possible by moving a token to a space, where an opposing piece is staying... but on the other half of the board! To identify the "mirrored" points, the points each have letters from A-Z.

A winning position can now also be reached when an opponent has only 3 tokens left.
25885.name: Cristallo

25886.name: Falle
25886.description:
The Heyne travel game "Falle" (=trap) is played on a board of 16x17 size with home regions of 8x4 spaces for the 2 players.

Each player has 8 playing pieces and 6 traps of different sizes. The traps are secretly deployed in the home regions by writing their position on a piece of paper.

Object of the game is to occupy one of the 2 opposing center spaces, which are in the opponent's home base and therefore well protected by the secret traps. As soon as a opposing token steps on a space with a trap, the trap is revealed (by placing the accompanying tile on the board) and it becomes an obstacle for both players from now on.

25887.description:
This Heyne travel game is played on a 2-piece board of 5x5 spaces. Each player has 5 tokens. Two opposing sides of the board are used as staring positions, but the 5 spaces always contain 2 tokens of one color and 3 tokens of the other.

Object of the game is to form a straight line of 4 tokens. To equalize the advantage of occupying the middle space of the board, this space must be left after 3 succeeding turns.

Included with this game are the rules for a second game, called "Lanxy". It is played with 3 tokens per player are uses only the inner 3x3 spaces of the board. Object of the game is to form a straight line of 3 tokens. But the player reaching this has not won the game yet: he scores a certain amount of points, depending on where he could form that row. The whole Lanxy consists of 5 games and the player with the most points is the winner.
25887.name: Phalanx

25888.name: Sing-Sing
25888.description:
This Heyne travel game is played on a 4-piece board showing 2x3 prisons and several traveling ways between them.

Each player has 18 tokens in 3 colors. The 6 tokens per color form 3 "tribes" of tokens, where one is the master tribe.

Object of the game is to capture all 6 tokens of the opposing master tribe. This is not so easy, because captured tokens can be rescued from the prisons and brought back into the game. Another problem is, that the tokens can only enter the game by throwing a 6. A player on the way to losing the game can therefore try to inhibit tokens from his master tribe to enter the game!

25889.name: CraCa
25889.description:
CraCa is a fast paced game of chance that combines the excitement of Casino craps and the challenge of strategic card play.

The game also allows you an opportunity to learn the basic rules of real Casino crap.

CraCa has all the fun and excitement of real Casino action. It can be played with two to eight players, singly or as partners. It is played and enjoyed by beginners, as well as advanced players of Casino craps.

25890.name: All About Town: Charlottesville, VA
25890.description:
To complete the game, you need to collect a number of items on a list that you receive at the beginning of the game.

You first go to the bank to get money, then you go to the different locations to get the items you need to complete the list.

25891.name: Where On Earth
25891.description: Description by publisher: WHERE ON EARTH is a game which not only entertains but also adds to your knowledge about geography, history, people and culture of the world's continents and countries. Yet WHERE ON EARTH is more than a game of knowledge since strategy and chance are employed and can influence the run of play.

25892.name: BrainTwister
25892.description:
BrainTwister
A fascinating game of logic and reasoning.
Two to four players compete trying to solve sequences of colorful geometric shapes.
A sequence-solving game. Players are shown a series of colored geometric shapes and they try to guess the color and shape of the sixth figure of the series. Puzzles range from the very simple to the very difficult. Depending on a die roll, players are shown only the first three, four, or five figures of the series; they then "bet" which figure will turn up sixth (once a player bets on a shape and color, no one else can make the same guess). In some cases, figures are shown one at a time, with players making bets after each unveiling. Challenging, educational, and fun.

25893.name: Imperial Guard
25893.description:
Imperial Guard is published with ziplock rules. They offer fast playing for Napoleonic era battles with 15 mm or 25 mm Airfix (or similar) miniatures.

A quick reference combat table speeds up the game play. A 20-digit percentile die is required, but must be purchased separately.

From the introduction:

"The Napoleonic wargame! It conjures up images of fire-belching artillery. massed infantry columns, daring cavalry charges, all with a special color and pageantry unmatched in other historical periods.

These are rules for miniature wargamers who prefer Napoleonic combat in that grand style. There is little skirmishing here except for those seemingly isolated incidents that link into the long chain of battle."

25894.name: Maneuver
25894.description:
Maneuver is a basic game for two players intended to help those who are new to simulations to understand the fundamental rules and procedures commonly found in wargames. It is an abstract treatment of conflict, and is not designed to cover any particular war or battle in a realistic fashion.

Published in Moves magazine Issue #71 Aug-Sept 1992

8x11" map with chart
20 die cut counters

25895.description:
Impartial game played with the 4x4 board full of one kind of pieces. A player may remove one or more adjacent pieces from a row or column. The loser is the person who takes the last piece off the board.

Note that the person who makes the last move loses. Making the last move to lose is misere version for most games, but the "normal" goal for this game.

A number of "folk art" versions of the game with a wooden board and marbles were found on the web. Computer program versions are also available.

The 4x4 game has been completely solved and it is a second player win.


History:

The game was evidently invented by Piet Hein (also known for game Hex) in the late 1940's. It isn't clear if the game was originally conceived on an NxN board or a 4x4 board. The game is in the public domain.

The first major publicity for the game was probably in Martin Gardner's Scientific American column in the February 1958 issue. The column and reader's responses were later re-printed in his first book collection of columns, "Hexaflexagons and other Mathematical Diversions; The First Scientific American Book of Mathematical Puzzles and Diversions." Mr. Gardner notes that reader's analysis left no doubt that the 4x4 game was a second player win even though no simply strategy was found.
25895.name: TacTix

25896.description: This 1940 game was given to children whose parents bought an appliance from Westinghouse. Players spin and move the around a fold-out paper board featuring comic strip characters Blondie and Dagwood, purchasing appliances such as a sandwich grill and a water heater before finally reaching Leisureland (a home full of electric appliances).
25896.name: Blondie Goes to Leisureland

25897.name: Scam: The Game of International Dope Smuggling
25897.description: This cultural novelty from Berkeley, California, features a large balloon-letter 'SCAM' logo on the poster tube that contains the rolled-up map and game components. Players roll dice and move on a colorful board, getting Connections cards or Paranoia cards, as they travel through places such as New York, Mexico, Afghanistan, South America, and even the planet Uranus, making dope deals. As they get more experience, they gain connection cards giving them more control over the way their deals go down. Surprisingly skillful undergournd adult drug themed commerce game.

25898.name: The Bicentennial Game
25898.description:
The Bicentennial Game
1776-1976
"Experience the Birth of Our Nation"

This game was published in 1976 by Doc Roc Enterprises. This game appears to be a teaching aid, as there is little to no strategy, and focuses on highlighting the people, places, and facts of the American Revolutionary War.

It is a roll-and-move game, with a board divided into three sections: a left circular track, a right snake-like track, and a middle track that is a straight-away to the victory space on top. Each space on the board has a bit of trivia that I assume is intended to be read aloud when a player lands on it.

The flow of the game is as follows:

Section I, People
Players roll and move on the right side of the board, landing on spaces that describe the major players of the war. Some spaces require you to draw a card, which could move you forward or backward. The object is to get to the end of the Section I path.

Section II, The Original 13 Colonies
Once they reach the end of Section I, players roll and move on the left side of the board, landing on spaces that represent the 13 colonies. If a player lands on a colony that they have not previously landed, they mark on a piece of paper that they have "collected" this colony. Players will continue on the circular path until they have "collected" all 13 colonies, which will allow them to move to Section III.

Section III, The American Character
A player rolls and moves up the center path towards the top of the board. The player must roll exactly to land on the last space, The Bell Tower, in order to win.

25899.name: Zulu
25899.description:
The booklet contains rules designed for use with 15mm or 25 mm figures. It enables players to recreate the Boer War, actions in Northwest India, as well as battles in the Sudan of 1884.

Zulus, Fuzzie Wuzzies, Dervishes, Trained Camel Troops, Artillery, Gatling Guns as well as Hidden Movement, Zareba fortifications, Supply and Firepower are included. A painting guideline for the figures is also included.

A 20-sided percentile die is required, but must be purchased separately.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Charles S. Roberts Best Ancient to Napoleonic Era Board Wargame Nominee
25900.description:
In 1097, thousands of lords and knights, soldiers and camp-followers, pilgrims and prophets marched east in response to a Papal appeal, charged with the task of restoring Jerusalem and the Holy Land to Christian control. Their surprising victory led to the creation of the first overseas European colonies and the reshaping of Muslim power in the Middle East. The repercussions of their journey continue to live with us today.

In Kingdom of Heaven - The Crusader States 1097-1291 (KOH) two players use cards to activate forces, trigger random events, conduct diplomacy or prosecute siege warfare on a vast arena stretching from Antioch to Cairo and from Cyprus to Mosul.

Nine scenarios cover all the major campaigns of the era, from the First, Second and Third Crusades to the Mongol invasion and the rise of the Mamluk Empire. In addition to the ‘basic deck,’ each scenario adds different cards representing historical events unique to that campaign. Turns are yearly, and most scenarios can be finished in 3-4 hours.

The historical scenarios pit the greatest commanders of the age against one another: Nur ad-Din, Richard the Lionhearted, Saladin, Frederick Barbarossa, Louis IX, Hulegu Khan, Baibars, and many others. They range in length from the 3-turn First Crusade learning scenario to the 7-turn assault of Baibars on the faltering ramparts of the Crusader States.

Kingdom of Heaven - The Crusader States 1097-1291 contains:
1 22x34” cardstock map
110 “poker quality” playing cards
528 5/8” counters
24 page rule book
24 page scenario book

Kingdom of Heaven - The Crusader States 1097-1291 was designed by Scott de Brestian, developed by Neil Randall, and features the art of Niko Eskubi and Mark Mahaffey

(source: MMP website and user's description)
25900.name: Kingdom of Heaven: The Crusader States 1097-1291
boardgamepodcastepisode: Guns, Dice, Butter Episode VIII: Sept 18, 2012
I've Been Diced! episode 43: A Descent into frustration, and a belated best/worst of 2012 list

25901.name: Krull Card Game
25901.description:
Card game based on the movie.

An adding game, where the players add cards (which represent characters from the movie) to a common pile. If the pile hits exactly 32, you capture all of the good (red) cards. If the pile total exceeds 32, you capture the black (bad) cards. Glaive cards allow removing cards from the pile.

25902.name: Los ovnis atacan
25902.description:
You must stop the ovnis and save the Earth by being the first player to arrive at the M marker with your pawn.

One of the Feber Juegos Cassette format games.

25904.name: L'Autoroute
25904.description:
This game was designed by the same author as Milles Bornes (1954), Edmond Dujardin. It was meant to make people more familiar with the driving code. The game won a prize: the 'Medaille d'argent au concours Lepine Paris 1949'.

The game was an ever-present on the French market under the same name since then, undergoing several editional faceliftings design-wise. The 1949 edition contained 6 small cars in lead, each car for a player. The goal of the game is to take your car to a wedding, to pick up family members and get a present on the way to the wedding. But first U have to get your driving license. This is done by moving on the track on the board and learning/respecting the road code (speed limit, unique direction). Several things can happen on the board: an accident, blown tire,... There also is a garage, a gangster, a dépanneur (troubleshooter) and a gangster that can be met on the board. Vintage game for collectors.

25905.name: Theodore Tugboat Cargo Game
25905.description:
Based on the CBC network children's television show.

From Back Cover
"Welcome to The Big Harbor, where Theodore The Tugboat and his friends spend their busy days. Young players more their tugboats from port to port, hoping to be the first to collect 4 different colored chips. Watch out where you land though; just when you think you've won, you lose a ship and have to start again."

The game has two forms of play, one without cards (younger children) and one with chance cards (older children).
To play the game you move your tugboat around the board based on a dice roll. Depending on where you land you either collect a colored disk (cargo), lose a colored disk (cargo), or nothing happens. The winner is the first player to get one of each colored disk and make it back to the beginning for the board.
In the older child version you can also receive chance cards, depending on where you land. The cards allow the player to move to specific locations, move extra spaces, take extra turns, or lose turns.

Rules in English and French.

25906.name: CityProGame Düsseldorf
25906.description:
Using the detailed street map of Düsseldorf, which is set out in four colors, each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the center as possible.

Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four ‘places worth seeing’ are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.

25907.name: Gone Bananas
25907.description:
"In GONE BANANAS your ID, EGO, and SUPEREGO come together on a game board that confronts you with real-life situations. You take risks and develop strategies. You will experience 'the thrill of victory and the agony of defeat.' But win or lose, you will know that you have been in a game!"

This is a fairly typical "special interest" roll-and-move game with a psychoanalytical theme and a couple unique twists.

As players move around the outer track, they collect ID, EGO, and WOW!/OW! (Superego) cards through square instructions and a Chance card mechanism. You use these cards throughout the game to buy BUTTONS and ZAPPERS, and to avoid penalties.

Linked at the corners of the outer track are four independent alternate routes, one each for the themes IS/EGO/SE and GONE BANANAS. While on these alternate paths you have the chance to earn a BUTTON (literally) of the corresponding color...but each path also entails risk and expense.

Some of the squares along the outer track where "Chance" cards are had can be "owned" by players by buying ZAPPERS with ID cards. Once bought, the squares are marked with one of the player's ZAPPER tokens. That player gets benefits for landing on the ZAPPER, while his opponents landing there have to give him a BUTTON or WOW! cards, and the opponent gets all his OW!s. Each ZAPPER location can be bought and re-bought (at a higher price) throughout the game.

The game ends immediately when one player has buttons of all four colors (representing a balanced personality) and more WOW!s than OW!s (representing positive self-worth...I guess).

The production value is first-class, as is the professional artwork on the nicely-mounted board. The bits are plastic and specially designed for the game - the player tokens are bananas on a little colored base. The cards are the only weak spot, small print on heavily-colored, cheapish card stock.

The double goal and constant shift of buttons might make this game a cut above the standard RaM fare. Keeping resource cards and buttons hidden would also increase the fun...and the chaos. I've had many of these low-volume specialty games pass through my thrifting hands, and this may be the first I actually try. The Freudian theme might wear thin early, but who knows, I might learn something about myself...or my mother.

25908.name: Jungle Jaws
25908.description:
Jungle Jaws is a simple children's game that involves catapulting your insects into the jaws of the waiting Venus Flytraps The winner is the person who gets the most bugs into the jaws of the jungle plants!

This is a great looking game with a 2 level board - four colorful Venus Flytraps on stalks and 4 sets of 4 plastic insects in different colors. You also get 4 leaf themed catapults to launch your insects. The board is held together with 1 large elastic band and the jaws of the Flytraps also snap closed thanks to elastic bands too.

The nice thing is that each bug is different instead of 4 identical ones and that the game looks great when assembled.

25909.name: Bob's Bouwplaats
25909.description: The game consists of a 80*80cm. carpet. It is based upon the Bob the Builder character from the cartoon series. The game is dice controlled and aimed at a target group from 3 years old.

25910.name: Superstars
25910.description:
Supersports is based upon a famous TV show on the BBC in the '70s till early '80s. Topsporters from several sports camped in different disciplines to determine the best overall sportsman (the late Swedish F1 driver Ronnie Peterson includes the winners list).

In this game those disciplines are: gymnastics, cycling, soccer, table tennis, 100m. sprint, steeplechase, swimming, shooting, weightlifting and canoing.

All disciplines are played with the use of dice. The board is 49x49cm. In each discipline points can be won, the winner of the overall classifying is the superstar. Vintage game for collectors and sports lovers.

25911.name: BrainCheck Two
25911.description:
BrainCheck Two is an alignment and configuration game. It is a variation of the various Morris games. It uses a board similar to Twelve Men’s Morris, but the board is color coded so that the red lines cannot be used to create a line of three. The game only uses ten men on a side.

The game starts with a placement phase, then a movement phase. Forming a line of three in either allows a player to remove on of his opponent’s men. A player reduced to two men loses. There are a number of other rules about movement and removal of men.

25912.name: InQUIZitive
25912.description:
From the box:

The action and fun begin with the first roll of the die as you accept the exciting challenge to become the first to graduate from InQUIZitive University.

Clues Make It Different! Strategy Makes It Fun!

At last, a quiz game in which every member of the family can compete on an equal level. Clues are the key, eliminating the frustration of almost knowing an answer -- giving less knowledgeable or younger players a fair opportunity to think out a correct response. So every player has a chance to win!

25913.name: Elemental Chess
25913.description:
Do you like to play chess and enjoy fantasy card games like Magic the Gathering? Then you will probably like Elemental Chess. It is based on classic chess rules but includes a twist of fantasy.

Instead of a full complement of chess pieces, each player begins the game with five pawns, two rooks, two knights, and an elementalist.

The elementalist moves like a king and is capable of casting spells from a deck of 32 cards. The spells are used to summon creatures from the various elements: earth, air, water, or fire.

Each turn a player will move an existing chess piece or cast a spell. The object of the game is to put your opponent's elementalist in checkmate.

25914.name: Really Wild Bug Eating Party
25914.description: A series of challenges are used to decide who will ultimately have to suffer the fate of eating a handful of bugs. At the start of the game players are split in to two teams and a leader for each team is nominated. Next a series of ‘bug’ cards are dealt out to each of the players. Lastly a spinner is spun to select a bug and if you’re the unfortunate person holding the most cards with that bug then you’ll have to eat it, that is unless your team can complete a challenge card…

25915.name: Keep the Customer
25915.description:
An industry-training boardgame to teach healthcare professionals and para-staff the finer points of customer service excellence from the customer's point of view so they are prepared for those tricky situations before they are faced with them in reality. Uses roll-a-die-move-around-the-board mechanics and a set of scenarios taken from real-life to role-play and discuss.

Components: 65 cards, board, game pieces, and a Healthcare Edition Facilitators Guide.
Also comes in a Call Center edition.

25916.name: The Story Game
25916.description:
This addictive game draws out the life stories - the funny, the embarrassing, the touching, the profound - things you've always wanted to share and maybe a few things you didn't. You're sure to learn something new about the other players whether you've known them for 20 minutes or 20 years!

Wannabe storytellers of the world, unite - you have nothing to lose but your boredom!

www.thestorygame.com

25917.name: Cup-Game
25917.description: Each player becomes both manager and trainer of one of the most important soccer teams in Europe. Players must show their financial abilities buying the best defenders, midfielders and strikers available in the market, as well as making good deals when they sell other players to keep the club’s treasury in good shape. When teams meet each other in the field, the most skillful trainer will likely choose the best winning tactics and lead his/her team to the victory and eventually to the Cup’s Final match...

25918.name: Len Choa
25918.description: Len Choa is one of a number of "Leopard Games", abstract hunt games played on a triangular board. This is the simplest of them, from Thailand, with one tiger facing six leopards on a board of ten points. First observed by westerners in 1836 but probably older.

25919.name: I Believe in Santa Claus!
25919.description: A game of lost and found in which players help Santa collect all eight of his reindeer so he can begin his trip to visit children all over the world

25920.description:
A fun party game for a group of 5 to 30 people to play. The rules of the game can be learned in less than 3 minutes. One person acts as moderator, overseeing a village of people, one (or more) of which are secretly Cthulhu worshippers! The worshippers begin sacrificing the other villagers one by one.
Optional cards add additional roles such as Protector, Seer and Vigilante.
Box art, and all cards, feature original art (paintings) done just for this game by Ron Spencer.

This is a re-theme of Werewolf.

Microbadge
Buy It
25920.name: Do You Worship Cthulhu?
boardgamepodcastepisode: OBG 32: Gaming with Large Groups

25921.name: Surfing
25921.description: This game appeared in the '70s and has an original theme with windsurfing. The game consists of a board with mainly water, surfboards and a small boats on. The mechanics are quite simple, it's a dice controlled game. The players move over spaces on the boards, each player controls a surfboard, the player who reaches the final space first has won the game.

25922.name: Strandmuscheln
25922.description:
"Shells from the Beach" is a light card game for all ages.
Players try to gather as many shells as possible. But they have to decide if they are satisfied with the ones they have already got or if they want more and risk to lose them all because the next card could be a starfish or a message in a bottle. Only one thing is sure: the next wave is coming...

The rules are included in the following languages:
* German
* English
* French
* Italian
* Dutch

25923.name: Narvik, Europa play aids kit 3
25923.description:
(from the back cover:)

This kit was designed for use with Narvik, 2nd edition, revised. You will not be able to use this kit with the 1st edition of Narvik. You will be able to use it with the 2nd edition Narvik with the following changes: At the bottom of map 10A you should add the range notation G-13 to hexes 5114 and 5115. Also add an airfield adjacent to the port of Kristansand on hex 4415.

It is important to remember that you must add the printed number of the range hexes to Bomber Command, Hatston Field, the off map Danish airfield and Germany when figuring total range with the air distance chart.

The Invasion Planning Chart is provided to aid the German player in the initial and follow-up waves. It can also be used by the Allies for their counter-landings.

The various tactical area charts are provided to allow for an expanded view of each victory point port. I have found that counter density around these ports can create problems, so the enlarged maps are provided.

CONTENTS:
This Kit contains the following components:

Two - 50% reduction Europa Maps, I0A and 5B
ONE - Rail and Air Distance Chart
ONE - Invasion Planning Chart
ONE - Off Map Air Display Chart
ONE - Terrain Key and Tactical Display Port Chart, NARVIK
ONE - Tactical Display Port Chart, NAMSOS, TRONDHIEM & ANDALSNES
ONE - Tactical Display Port Chart, BURGEN, HAUGESUND, STAVANGER & KRISTIANSAND

25924.name: Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edicion II (Spain)
25924.description:
This version of Trivial has only one major change concerning the classic Trivial Pursuit: there are no dice squares (with the classic picture of the monk throwing a giant dice), but "shortcut squares" instead. Each of them allows the player to reach (depending on the color of the square) directly one of the six cheese portion squares.
Also, there are only five squares between cheese portion spaces, so it's possible to reach one from another with a six in the dice.
Those small changes make the game faster.

For the rest it's just like the old Trivial: you have to gain all the cheese portions, one of each different color (which means different kind of knowledge), you can move your counter as long as you answer correctly to general knowledge questions.

25925.name: Origin of Failing Water
25925.description:
Origin of Failing Water (落水邸物語 or Rakusuitei Monogatari in Japanese) is a clever card game based on the system of trick-taking. There are six tricks, with the winner gaining positive or negative points for each trick. However, you must play from the last (sixth) trick, followed by the fifth, fourth, etc. until the first trick. Then players resolve tricks from first to sixth according to normal non-trump trick-taking rules.

To add more twist, everyone starts with one "thinking" card. You can play it instead of a regular card on any single trick, then replace it with the remaining card you have in your hand once cards are resolved.

Your score is the absolute value of what you collected, so you want to collect either positives or negatives but not both. A player who didn't take any tricks also scores if they're the only one without a trick.

This game has been called Origin of Falling Water in error. Just as the word in the Japanese title Rakusuitei is slightly different from the usual Japanese Rakusuiso for "Falling Water", the decision was made to have a similar pun in English and use "Failing Water" instead of "Falling Water".

25926.name: Aera
25926.description:
Aera was published by New Dimensions of Corvallis, OR, and reviewed in GAMES, April/May 1987. The games was for two players, Red and Blue, each has 6 pieces in his own color, numbered 1 to 6. There is, first a drop phase, then a movement phase with each phase being in numerical sequence.

For the dropping phase Red drops 1, then Blue drops 1. Red drops 2, then Blue drops 2, and so forth through Blue dropping 6. Now the movement phase starts. The pieces are now moved in numerical sequence. So Red moves his 1, then blue moves his 1. Red moves his 2, then blue moves his 2 and so on. In addition the pieces are started with the silver side up. When the pieces are played a second time, then they are flipped to the other side, gold, to help keep track of the sequence.

The object is to score points; one point is scored by forming a line of four of the players pieces, either orthogonal or diagonal. The first player to score six points wins.

The original pieces, according to the review, were not numbered. The "1" was a clear acrylic disc showing a circle, the "2" was an vesica piscis (oval with pointed ends), the "3" an equilateral triangle, "4" a square, "5" a pentagon, and "6" a hexagon.

25927.name: Old World, New World
25927.description:
Discover a New World... And Fight for It!
Players start as a small island nation off the coast of a large continent. They receive initial resources, colonists, cash and a ship to search for a rumored new land.

Turns are taken by choosing specific roles which allow movement, technology advances, and investment in the Old World or influence on the continent, outfitting ships, investment cash, and diplomatic efforts. Only two roles are chosen per turn and then all movement and actions are played out. Players must explore the New World and found farms, posts, towns, and harvest resources. They then score points and generate income shipping new goods to the Old World, and then can score points shipping supplies back to the New World. Nations must also balance defense against rival nations while protecting their investment in the New World on land and sea. OWNW is different each game. Explorers and ships reveal new hexes that have a type of terrain and a potential special resource. All terrain has a carrying capacity, which cannot be improved until the player builds farms. While exploring and settling the New World, players also play technology advances back at home which improves ship speed, manpower, reduces cost of men and goods, and allows for special buildings.

Game features:
-role selection.
-known and unknown map.
-hex based discovery, changes each game.
-carrying capacity per hex which may be modified
-resource extraction and management
-shipping goods, soldiers, colonists.
-tech advancement.
-piracy and conflict on land and sea / all units are unarmed until you decide to arm them!
-colonization, simple building tech tree.
-Area control through role selection of Old World for endgame points.
-multi-path scoring: building, influence, shipping, exploration.
-basic units and characters with special abilities.
-'touring' mechanism for specific mapmaker, envoy, etc... characters.

This game is still in development.

25928.name: Launch
25928.description:
From the box:

"A Space Shuttle Family Card Game"

An exciting family card game for the whole world!

Launch is a spectacular card game in which you play through the various stages of launching a NASA Space Shuttle orbiter. The pack of 108 cards includes, 12 different fast action maneuvers including, Crew on Board, Systems Check, Count Down Cards and Lift Off!

Your skill and luck will be tested to their outer limits. Easy to understand rules are enclosed.

The whole family will want to play the world's first "authentic" Space Shuttle Card Game.

Easy to play! Great fun! Anyone can win!

25929.description:
When Nazi armies launched their sneak attack on the Soviet Union in June 1941, Spanish fascists exulted. Still nursing deep hatreds from the Soviet role in the Spanish Civil War, thousands volunteered to fight alongside the Germans. Spanish dictator Francisco Franco organized them into a “Blue Division” to carry the fight to the Russians and, not coincidentally, send the most politically active fascists far away from Madrid.

Blue Division is a supplement to the Panzer Grenadier series, focusing on the actions of this unit between 1941 and 1943. Organized as a standard German infantry division, the Spanish unit fought well in some of the hardest fighting of the campaign. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Eastern Front and Road to Berlin to play all of the scenarios.

All the new pieces represent Spanish volunteer forces: infantry, ski, engineer, motorcycle, bicycle and machine-gun troops; anti-tank guns, mortars and artillery, and of course leaders. Scenarios cover actions of these units between their arrival on the Eastern Front in October, 1941 and their departure almost exactly two years later.

Contents:
20 Scenarios
77 pieces

This game is part of the Panzer Grenadier series
25929.name: Panzer Grenadier: Blue Division
boardgameexpansion: Panzer Grenadier: Arctic Front Deluxe Edition
Panzer Grenadier: Battle of the Bulge

25930.name: Mijn!
25930.description: Game about the auction of vegetables (!). Players move around the board with a die that doesn't have numbers but vegetables marked on. Whenever a player is on an auction space, an auction is triggered. The auction is done in a similar way as in The Merchants of Amsterdam, meaning that players have to hit a spring driven auction clock to place a bid and win the auction. The object is to buy your vegetables cheap (during an auction) and to sell them with profit (whenever one is one a vegetable space of a sort that one has bought). I suspect this light Dutch bidding game with a high dose of luck (due to the die) was released in the early '90s.

25931.description:
Note: This game was never released.

From The Alderac Entertainment Group Forum:

"Briefly I will say that it looks like Samurai Swords - map divided into areas, little toy soldiers and forts - but plays very differently. It is not a hack and bash, grab lots of provinces to win game, but a game that can be won in one swift stroke by controlling five key areas (or "rings"). There is a great interplay between the players who understand this and look to the board position, and the players who don't, judging another's strength by his income and troop levels. The latter kind of player generally does not win.

It's also not the ultimate flavor simulation of Rokugan. Its complexity level is roughly that of Axis and Allies. It gains flavor through clans' special action cards and through subtle differences in their board position and unit stats, and for the most part these are very true to the World of Rokugan.

The game starts with the six original Imperial factions but there will almost certainly follow an expansion representing other popular groups in Rokugan."
25931.name: Legend of the Five Rings: Art of War
boardgamepodcastepisode: Strange Assembly 065 - GenCon 2012 L5R Design Team Interview
Strange Assembly 084 - Herald

25932.name: Slaget om Blodsgläntan
25932.description:
Introductory fantasy wargame included in Swedish games magazine Sinkadus number 16 (December 1988). The theme and background story is taken from the at the time very popular Swedish role playing game Drakar och Demoner. One player controls an invading orc army and the other player controls the human and elf defenders trying to stop them. Included are two pages of rules, a small color map and a sheet of one-sided unmounted counters.

Besides the standard two-player version there are also rules included for playing with three or four players.

25933.name: Do U Know?
25933.description:
From Retailer:

A compact game for full-size fun! Turn playtime into Bible-time with this fast-paced family card game. It's similar to Uno, but in addition to matching colors and numbers, players must answer questions about Bible facts, characters, and stories. Perfect for long road trips and rainy afternoons, you'll increase your knowledge of important Bible characters and events, and it's so much fun, you kids won't even realize they're learning! Do U Know? is great for the whole family, especially ages 5 and up.

25934.name: Thaxx
25934.description:
From the Publisher's website:
"THAXX features a solid oak ship's plank, authentic replicas of the Elcazador's Lost Treasure and a historical game in which you attempt to plunder the loot of your opponent. The game of Thaxx seems as though it was ripped from the deck of the great ship and into your hands. Thaxx is easy to learn with fast paced game play for ages 6 and up."

On your turn, you roll the dice. You either add a coin to the number on the board that is the sum of the dice or add two coins to the respective numbers. (e.g., if you roll a 2 and a 3, you could place a coin on the two and a coin on the three, or place a coin on the five)
You may also use one of the numbers to remove one from your opponent's board and place it on your own. (e.g, take from your opponent's 3 and put it on your two).
There are no sixes, sixes do nothing. In fact, rolling double sixes requires you to remove one of your own coins. Otherwise, rolling doubles allows you to go again.
The first to cover all his/her numbers wins.

25935.name: Mitsubishi Space Game
25935.description: The game consists of a board with a track in the form of an eight in it's length. The box contains a red die, 66 Mitsubishi model cards, 33 chance cards, 6 markers and a rulebook. The goal of the game is to collect as soon as possible the 11 different Mitsubishi car models that appear in this game. These models are: Carisma, Colt, Eclipse, L200, L300, Lancer, Pajero, Space Gear, Lancer Station Wagon, Space Runner, Space Wagon. The game was created Mitsubishi Motors Europe to promote their cars.

25936.description:
The gameboard is a map of the United States displaying 128 cities. There are four types of cities. Depending on the type of city a player’s pawn lands a player may raise funds, spend funds to get vote chips, declare vote chips for a state in the hopes of getting a plurality to earn that state’s electoral votes or go head-to-head with another opponent in a debate. Lines connect the cities to regulate the movement of the players’ pawns.

The players divide $72 million dollars and each chooses a different city to start the game. To move, a player rolls the die and advances that many cities unless the roll in a one and that allows a free move to anywhere on the gameboard. The city landed upon regulates what a player’s actions are on that turn. After taking one’s turn the player advances the calendar pawn one day. The game is over after seventy-two days. The players add up their votes and each state’s electoral votes are awarded to the player who has the most votes. Ties go to whomever rolls the higher number. States where no one has any votes goes to the player who has declared the most popular votes in that region. The player who has the most electoral votes is the winner of the game.
25936.name: Running for President

25937.description:
Galactic Destiny is a game of empire building, politics and warfare on a galactic scale. It is a science fiction game with some fantasy elements. Players represent (up to six) political parties that try to gain as much power as possible in the galaxy. Parts of that galaxy may however be taken over by ‘evil forces’ and the chances of that happening increase with the increasing corruption by the senators.

"Galactic Destiny is the newest in Science Fiction Universes. 3 - 6 players represent the Senators & Fleets of their cosmic constituency. Players face-off against each other to win the Galaxy to their own ideology. Win through Politics, war, or intrigue and manipulation...
... Oh, yes. And there's Demons. The evil Ke'Ras threaten to possess the galaxy & even your Senators, whenever you act corruptly, back stab, or cheat your friends. Enjoy the Infestation!" (from www.goldenlaurel.com)
25937.name: Galactic Destiny

25940.name: Bumpers
25940.description:
Partisan game with one player using green pieces and the other pink. Pieces are slid into a 5x5 grid of playing positions pushing pieces already in that row or column along the line of the piece inserted. Five in a line wins.

Similar to Overboard which has 6x6 grid of playing positions, and Slide 5 which you can only insert pieces along two edges instead of four.

25943.name: Sludge
25943.description:
From the cover:
SLUDGE Pick up your sludge at the factory, then sell it to your distributors around the board. Sounds easy - but watch out for the competition; and the Income Tax; and those business cards! Fun for the whole family ages 8 to adult.

25944.description:
When Juliet is at home alone at night, the monsters awake and creep up from behind wardrobes and beds. They are keen on a tasty midnight snack. With flashlight and fly swatter Juliet sets out to defend herself. Will she survive until dawn?

There are two ways to win: Save Juliet or eat her!

Somewhere amongst the cards, she is hiding. Draw from your opponents, combine the clues and get onto Julchen's trail. Send your monsters out or grab Julchen and protect her from unwanted snack attacks.
25944.name: Julchen und die Monster

25945.description:
This expansion to the Arkham Horror Series, introduces a major new mechanic to the game -- Heralds, who prepare the way for the Ancient One to arrive. In addition, old familiar faces will be turned against the investigators in ways they never expected.

Featuring over 160 new cards, The King in Yellow heralds a darker age for Arkham Horror fans.


13 Blight cards, old friends gone irretrievably mad.
7 Magical Effect cards representing powerful new abilities.
The new Herald mechanic and the King in Yellow Herald.
3 new Monster tokens, more horrible than any before!
Over 160 new cards, detailing new items, new spells, and new horrible happenings in Arkham and beyond!
25945.name: Arkham Horror: The King in Yellow Expansion

25946.description:
Expansion pack for PitchCar only. This is not compatible with Carabande.

Contains:

Four 45-degree curves
Two 90 degree curves for crossroads
Two classic straightaways.




Expands:

PitchCar (but not Carabande)




Buy Microbadge
25946.name: PitchCar Extension 2

25947.description:
Expansion pack for PitchCar Mini. It contains four new 45-degree curves, two new curves to be able to do crossroads, and two classic straight lines.

Expands:

PitchCar Mini




Buy Microbadge
25947.name: PitchCar Mini Extension 2

25948.description:
PitchCar pieces released at Essen 2006. Not compatible with Carabande.

These are two quadruple-length straight pieces that should allow for very fast straightaways.

Expands:

PitchCar (but not Carabande)




Buy Microbadge
25948.name: PitchCar Special Long Straights

25949.name: Revolver
25949.description:
From the publishers web site:

Showdown in the street! With Revolver, you and an opponent can mimic the gunfights of the old west, facing off one-on-one, guns blazing, bullets flying, and victory or death the only escape.

Using your two six-guns, each with its own special "bullets" deck, and your own deck of 27-cards, you can play out these fights quickly and easily -- most games are over in 10 to 15 minutes. Revolver is a great filler game to pass the time as you wait for the rest of your game group to arrive.

You will need three different colors of card stock (or only white card stock if you use the colored card backs included in the download file), a printer, scissors, and an opponent to play this game.

Game design by Philip Reed.
Illustrated by John Kovalic.
For 2 players.

25950.description:
Swedish game. The game map is made up of two separate parts. One two-dimensional map portraying the wastelands outside Castle Greyskull. The second map is 3-D layout of the castle itself.

The object of the game is to race to defeat Skeletor in the throne room of the Castle. In order to get there and perform the task, the heroes need to collect items in the wasteland that will help them on their task.

Once inside the castle, they must avoid all the traps set by Skeletor before they can finally reach the throne room.
25950.name: Masters of the Universe

boardgamehonor: 2010 Lucca Games Best Card Game
25951.description:
Castle of the Devil is a 4-8 player card game.

All players are passengers within a carriage that is rushing to Devil's Castle. They each act as a member of a secret association, but no one knows who is friend and who is foe.

Each player starts in one of two secret associations. He also gets a secret profession with a special ability. So at the beginning of the game you have no information about the membership and the professions of the others. To win the game, each association has to collect 3 defined artifacts jointly. Therefore you have to find out who your allies are and where to find the artifacts among the other secret objects that are in possession of other players. You can get this information during the game either by trading objects with other players, because every object has a special ability, e.g. "Trade it in and you may take a look at your trading partners-association." or by struggling with other players, because the winner of a struggle can view the cards of the underdog and steal one of them. But be careful, all players can support the attacker OR defender in a struggle. If they know about your identity but you don't know theirs it may be risky to struggle.

Turn actions, one of:
Trade
Duel
Spy - Choose another player and draw one random object card from her/his hand. Look at this object without revealing it to the other players. Then give it back to her/him.
Declare Victory by naming your team and who has the three items, starting with yourself, OR declare the opposing team and their items.

If someone refuses a trade you offer, you get a duel token as compensation. These tokens are used as extra votes that can be applied in future duels.
Duels: Everyone declares sides secretly and simultaneously. Then anyone can apply items, professions and duel tokens in any order. Players must declare for one or the other and abstentions are not allowed.

Victory: Declare Victory by naming your team and who has the three items, starting with yourself, then one by one. If you name players on your team incorrectly or they don't have the object(s) you lose. You can also declare victory by announcing the opposing team and the members of that team holding their objects by naming them, as firstly part of the team, and secondly that they have a relevant object. If you get the player's team wrong or they don't have the object(s) you lose.

Reimplements: Die Kutschfahrt zur Teufelsburg
25951.name: The Castle of the Devil
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cubepushers - Episode 3: To Theme Or Not To Theme

25952.name: Cetacean Ascension Moonbase 8
25952.description:
From the publisher:

It’s the year 3535. You’re a hyperevolved intelligent whale. You and your cohorts have been selected out of hundreds of petitioners for a rare opportunity: Sufficient psychic energy has accumulated for one of you to Transcend, becoming a being of pure thought. To access this energy, your pod’s elders have transported you to Cetacean Ascension Moonbase 8 (CAM 8), a cluster of underground lakes at the polar ice cap of the moon.

To channel the pool of psychic power and successfully Transcend, you must expand your mental faculties by growing. This requires vast amounts of the lunar krill that live in the lakes. Unfortunately, the seed lakes at CAM 8 can not support enough krill for you grow and ascend. You are not capable of performing the excavation required to expand your lake. Fortunately, you have a small group of giant hamsters you’ve genetically engineered to perform specific tasks, such as digging tunnels and harvesting krill.

Will you be the first to sufficiently expand and flood your network of tunnels, thereby harvesting enough krill to grow and successfully ascend?

25953.description:
From the excitement of the Canada Day fireworks and the frozen fun of Winterlude, to the hi-tech innovation of Silicon Valley North and the intrigue of national politics, Ottawa is truly an amazing city. Queen Victoria and Colonel By sure knew how to pick a unique and exciting Capital. Where else can you skate for seven kilometers on a frozen canal, stop and eat a world famous Beaver Tail (no, not the kind on the nickel), and visit a national museum all in one day. It can only be Ottawa, the coolest city in Canada.

Now, how would you like to own it? Ottawa On Board is a unique real estate trading game that celebrates our Nation's Capital, as well as the businesses, attractions and people that make it so special.
